title: GazetaBitcoin
author: GazetaBitcoin
created_time: February 19, 2023, 11:33:44 PMLast edit: June 04, 2023, 11:21:17 AM by GazetaBitcoin
content: I had this in my mind for a log time now (cca. 2018-2019). I remember someone told me that theymos appears in a documentary about Bitcoin, but I don't remember movie's name.All I remember is that it was (could have been?) one of the following titles:The Rise and Rise of BitcoinBanking On BitcoinDeep WebBitcoin: The End of Money As We Know ItMagic Money - The Bitcoin RevolutionBitcoin: Shape the FutureDoes anyone know which one is the movie starring theymos? Or, in case it's none of these movies, does anybody know a documentary where he appears?Thanks in advance.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Do you know his real name or do you recognize his face? I do and I know he doesn't like for his privacy to be violated, so I stopped talking about it few years ago when I saw that staff removed the posts with his name mentioned. If he has decided to retain his privacy, let us honor and respect that. Though I do love to hear from him from time to time, know his inputs on several topics about the crypto currencies in general.

comments.author: NicNacCoin
comments.body: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on February 19, 2023, 11:33:44 PMDoes anyone know which one is the movie starring theymos? Or, in case it's none of these movies, does anybody know a documentary where he appears?Theymos (AKA Theymos)In fact, it is not his real name but the name he uses on the bitcoin.org website, no matter how much you search for it, no information will come up. Because he has hidden all the information from the website. Moreover, it is better not to openly discuss such reputable users like them in the forum.Some information about Theymos: https://twitter.com/lopp/status/833069303691874304?s=19However, the above link is provided for your information only, if I have broken any rules outside the forum rules, I will remove the link.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: Yeah, privacy matters, don't post identity related information if you don't want to get banned.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on February 19, 2023, 11:54:01 PMDo you know his real nameActually, yes. Or I know what is believed to be his name. As you can see, NicNacCoin also posted a Twitter link containing this information.Quote from: digaran on February 19, 2023, 11:54:01 PMor do you recognize his face?Actually that friend of mine recognized him in one of those documentaries, but I don't know if he managed to do it because theymos' name appeared somewhere during the documentary or because he actually knew how theymos looks like.All I remember is that I watched all those documentaries and, at some point, I was talking to my friend about one of them. It's just I don't know about which one we were talking. And he said something like "this documentary is even more interesting, as theymos also appears inside the footage".And I am sure that it's one of those documentaries because I did not watch any other Bitcoin documentary excepting those ones (and I know that because I wrote their names down at some point). So it's one of them.I asked this question to avoid watching all six movies again, as it would take a lot of time (especially if, considering my infamous unluck, I'm sure that the movie where theymos appears will be the last one I'll watch from all those 6 documentaries).

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: NicNacCoin on February 20, 2023, 05:59:39 AMIn fact, it is not his real name but the name he uses on the bitcoin.org website, no matter how much you search for it, no information will come up. Because he has hidden all the information from the website. Moreover, it is better not to openly discuss such reputable users like them in the forum.First, you say that it is impossible to find any information, and then you post a link that leads directly to the identity of the admin? However, I don't think it's such a security problem because @theymos identity has been known for a long time and he never hid it, and long ago he explained his reasons for not wanting to do it.Quote from: theymos on May 19, 2011, 07:05:56 PMAt some point I might want to take credit for my Bitcoin activities, so I don't want to use a fake name. In fact, I would list Bitcoin Block Explorer on my résumé if I was applying for a relevant job this year, since that's the biggest and most public programming project I've ever done.Using a non-obvious pseudonym might be a good idea for people who want to be anonymous. It adds some apparent credibility, I think.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: Lucius on February 20, 2023, 10:33:01 AMFirst, you say that it is impossible to find any information, and then you post a link that leads directly to the identity of the admin?Lol, I also noticed that and it made me laugh a lot =)))In any case, I just remembered that there is one more documentary about Bitcoin which I also watched and I added to OP: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on February 19, 2023, 11:33:44 PMBitcoin: Shape the FutureAnd I think this is the one... I remember this is the most recent I watched and it intrigued me the way it was filmed: is has a shadowy narrator, talking with a distorted voice, this being a hacker, if I remember well. At some point he describes how he made "his first sack of money" or something like that. And it was even more interesting, as it was the only Japanese documentary about Bitcoin. Maybe this is the one I talked about with my friend... However, I can not be sure. But if nobody knows, if nobody actually watched these documentaries, then I guess I'll have to watch them all again, one by one. But I'll start with this one.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Should Theymos get too nervous about his name mentions on articles and post since everyone can come up with something new to claim being Theymos or use his name on different occasions for their personal reasons either in appreciating the value and weigh in the name or to decieve people they are the bearer, but we should know that Theymos will never appreciated his real privacy being violated by people, the bone of contention here is no one knows his identity in person, if he was the real personality starred in a movie, book or an article or not, but the only one we are sure of is about his bitcointalk identity, any other is a guess and anyone can claim being Theymos just as many have been claiming they are Satoshi.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on February 20, 2023, 10:46:56 AM[...]Have you ever heard of dot? You know, it's a punctuation sign, graphically represented like this: .. It is used for separating sentences.By looking at what you wrote, at your 132 words phrase, I am wondering if you wanted to compete with longest phrase from literature, which appears in Victor Hugo's Les Misérables, this one having 823 words.Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on February 20, 2023, 10:46:56 AMShould Theymos get too nervous about his name mentions on articlesWhy should he?Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on February 20, 2023, 10:46:56 AMeveryone can come up with something new to claim being Theymos or use his name on different occasions for their personal reasons either in appreciating the value and weigh in the name or to decieve people they are the bearer... unless he starred the respective documentary at his own will.Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on February 20, 2023, 10:46:56 AMbut we should know that Theymos will never appreciated his real privacy being violated by peopleWho and how violated theymos' privacy?Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on February 20, 2023, 10:46:56 AMno one knows his identity in personSince he is a public figure and he actually said what Lucius mentioned, respectively:Quote from: theymos on May 19, 2011, 07:05:56 PMAt some point I might want to take credit for my Bitcoin activities, so I don't want to use a fake name. In fact, I would list Bitcoin Block Explorer on my résumé if I was applying for a relevant job this year, since that's the biggest and most public programming project I've ever done.Using a non-obvious pseudonym might be a good idea for people who want to be anonymous. It adds some apparent credibility, I think.then how can you come up saying no one knows his identity?Quote from: Aanuoluwatofunmi on February 20, 2023, 10:46:56 AMany other is a guess and anyone can claim being Theymos just as many have been claiming they are SatoshiAre you just eagerly trying to fill your quote for the campaign you are enrolled or what's the reason of this ridiculous post which has only one dot within 132 words?

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: I remember back in the old days, if you were to write his real name on a post, a bot would detect and delete the post, maybe staff were trolling me back then. Funny, I PMed theymos telling him that people are trying to dox him. I can't show my face around here anymore. I only wrote 2 PMs in 6 years, one to resign as a m source, one just a few hours ago.I would still suggest you not to disclose personal information here, maybe try investigation board, because it's hidden from google and scrapers.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: OP you also started stated the year documentary was released. So that it would be easy for those who have watched to tell you the title. Like me I have not seen theymos but from the documentary films present by OP and I watched them on YouTube and the presentations of the films I will say it is "The Rise and Rise of Bitcoin" which was film in (2024). You can also get the full documentary in www.bitcoindoc.com. Concerning the real name of theymos, I believe he likes the anonymity of the name, even though anyone  knows the real name  because he is close relative or friends, it is not advisable to do that let the bear of the name do that. It is his identity.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on February 20, 2023, 10:39:53 AMLol, I also noticed that and it made me laugh a lot =)))I used to laugh at such posts, but when you read at least a dozen of them every day, you realize that you only have two options - ignore or report to moderator button. In any case, I hope you find what you are looking for Quote from: digaran on February 20, 2023, 12:46:24 PMFunny, I PMed theymos telling him that people are trying to dox him. ---I would still suggest you not to disclose personal information here, maybe try investigation board, because it's hidden from google and scrapers.I don't know where you see someone trying to expose someone? All the information in this thread has been publicly available for years, and anyone who knows how to use the forum search engine or any public search engine can find this information. This nonsense about someone deleting every post or thread in which someone's name is mentioned is pure nonsense, because the thread I quoted has existed since 2011 and do you really think that the admin would not have removed it by now if he considered it necessary?In addition, he shares his first and last name with dozens of other people, and most people who would like to investigate further would get stuck at that step.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.created_time: February 20, 2023, 06:23:07 PMLast edit: May 26, 2023, 10:20:01 AM by GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: digaran on February 20, 2023, 12:46:24 PMI PMed theymos telling him that people are trying to dox himMy finger is itching me to start deleting your posts. Where have you seen anything about doxxing here?Quote from: digaran on February 20, 2023, 12:46:24 PMI can't show my face around here anymoreThat's probably best idea.Quote from: Mate2237 on February 20, 2023, 02:18:29 PMOP you also started stated the year documentary was released.I am not sure I'm following. What "year documentary"? And what is a "year documentary"? And where did I state that anyway?Quote from: Mate2237 on February 20, 2023, 02:18:29 PMSo that it would be easy for those who have watched to tell you the title.I was hoping for that...Quote from: Mate2237 on February 20, 2023, 02:18:29 PM"The Rise and Rise of Bitcoin" which was film in (2024).This is certainly not a 2024 movie, lol. How, in the world, could it be released in 2024 if we are in 2023? How could you have watched it? =)))In any case, this is a movie from 2014:Quote from: Mate2237 on February 20, 2023, 02:18:29 PMYou can also get the full documentary in www.bitcoindoc.com.Thank you for the link. It's also available on Youtube, at the link I shared in OP.So, in any case, have you watched this documentary? Is this the one starring theymos?Quote from: Mate2237 on February 20, 2023, 02:18:29 PMConcerning the real name of theymos, I believe he likes the anonymity of the name, even though anyone  knows the real name  because he is close relative or friends, it is not advisable to do that let the bear of the name do that. It is his identity.Jesus, where did all this insanity come from?! Who ever talked about mentioning theymos' identity anywhere?! This topic was only about finding in which documentary he appears, not for writing his name here and there.Seriously, where do all these ideas come from?!Quote from: Lucius on February 20, 2023, 03:44:02 PMI used to laugh at such posts, but when you read at least a dozen of them every day, you realize that you only have two options - ignore or report to moderator button. In any case, I hope you find what you are looking for It seems an entire hysteria started yet I don't know from where nor why. I think I'll start deleting posts soon, lol. One talks about doxxing, one talks about a movie from 2024, which he watched already, one writes a 100+ words phrase, competing with Victor Hugo... I don't understand what I have done so wrong to have all these people replying in my topics (facepalm). Now instead of talking about documentaries I have to talk about (denying) doxxing. Jesus!

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Thanks OP for listing these documentaries. I would love to watch them not because I care about who Theymos is, I just think I will learn something new from these documentaries. As for those ranting about doxxing, it been said the person in question has always kept his identity open. I hope this documentaries featured bitcointalk because I think the forum needs more exposure.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on February 20, 2023, 06:23:07 PMNow instead of talking about documentaries I have to talk about (denying) doxxing. Jesus!Well, to be honest, I have read about your request much eariler and watched the story develop.A movie or documentary can easily have its entire cast published. As real names. And this can easily end up with doxxing.By how I know you, I am certain that this is not your intention, but still, it can get to that.For now this topic looks like an incredible listing of Bitcoin related movies, but, no offense, but I would not have too many hopes to get answers to... that question...

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 20, 2023, 08:55:32 PMA movie or documentary can easily have its entire cast published. As real names. And this can easily end up with doxxing.Does it count as doxxing if the personal information is already published on the internet? I would think not.If theymos is very keen on keeping any personal data private and may have erroneously revealed some details they would prefer buried, it would be wrong to chase down and reveal those details. But if he is not so keen about it, then I do not see anything wrong in being curious to know what documentary he starred in.- Jay -

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: un_rank on February 20, 2023, 09:27:55 PMQuote from: NeuroticFish on February 20, 2023, 08:55:32 PMA movie or documentary can easily have its entire cast published. As real names. And this can easily end up with doxxing.Does it count as doxxing if the personal information is already published on the internet? I would think not.Imho it is. As long as the person didn't reveal his identity and it's not obvious (and this may be debatable too) who it is, finding out the identity (even from public sources) is imho doxxing simply because what is maybe easy-to-find for you, may not be as obvious for many others....But I may be wrong.

comments.author: GazetaBitcoin
comments.created_time: February 20, 2023, 09:54:24 PMLast edit: February 20, 2023, 11:47:05 PM by GazetaBitcoin
comments.body: Quote from: SatoPrincess on February 20, 2023, 06:48:00 PMThanks OP for listing these documentaries. I would love to watch them not because I care about who Theymos is, I just think I will learn something new from these documentaries. As for those ranting about doxxing, it been said the person in question has always kept his identity open. I hope this documentaries featured bitcointalk because I think the forum needs more exposure.Hehe, I just realized now that, while trying to find a movie starring theymos, I also shared some very interesting materials for those interested about Bitcoin at large. I can grant you, all documentaries are worth watching. If I may suggest you, I'd recommend to start with Bitcoin: Shape the Future, continue with The Rise and Rise of Bitcoin, then Deep Web. Then you can pick the rest in any order you wish If you are so interested in such materials, I can also recommend you some more movies / documentaries, these ones being about Ross Ulbricht, Julian Assange, WikiLeaks and Edward Snowden. Again, all are worth watching.Silk Road Case - The Real, Untold Story - documentary about the injustice suffered by Ross Ulbricht during Silk Road trialIthaka - a documentary showing Julian's struggle to avoid extradition to USMediastan: A Wikileaks Road Movie - a WikiLeaks very own documentary - full movieRisk - a WikiLeaks documentary, directed by Laura Poitras (a friend of Julian Assange) - full movieThe Fifth Estate - a great movie about WikiLeaksWe Steal Secrets: The Story of WikiLeaks - yet another documentary about WikiLeaksUnderground: The Julian Assange Story - another movie about Julian, depicting his early careerCitizenfour - documentary about Snowden, starring himselfSnowden - fiction movie about Snowden, starring Joseph Gordon-LevittI hope this helps.Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 20, 2023, 08:55:32 PMQuote from: GazetaBitcoin on February 20, 2023, 06:23:07 PMNow instead of talking about documentaries I have to talk about (denying) doxxing. Jesus!Well, to be honest, I have read about your request much eariler and watched the story develop.A movie or documentary can easily have its entire cast published. As real names. And this can easily end up with doxxing.Oh well, that makes sense a bit. I did not think about that...In any case, I believe that if theymos actually had a - how is it called? - cameo ( ) inside a movie, he appeared with his nym, not with his name. I am sure that from all those which ever heard about theymos, 99% know only the nym theymos and maybe (only maybe!) 1% know his name. And that 1% may be a big number. Most likely, if you'd tell his name to those knowing the nym theymos, they will just nod their heads, without understanding about who you are talking.Following this idea, I am also certain that, if theymos ever appeared in a documentary (after all, my friend could have been wrong, leading me to live with this impression in vain), then he appeared in credits as theymos. If his name were there nobody would know who is the one they watched, lol (or almost nobody).

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: ^That's a great list. I've watch some of these and never had time to watch others, but they've been on my list for some time. I don't agree with everything said in them but they give you a certain perspective, makes your opinion stronger about certain facts. Especially liked all the silk road movies. Quote from: digaran on February 20, 2023, 06:54:16 AMYeah, privacy matters, don't post identity related information if you don't want to get banned.I doubt he cares that we talk about this and you shouldn't be afraid of being banned for it. He's a popular person and it's obvious people will have questions and will be interested in seeing him on camera. When you google his nickname, his real name comes up, so deleting posts that contain it is a waste of time, same as banning people who mention it.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: GazetaBitcoin on February 19, 2023, 11:33:44 PMDoes anyone know which one is the movie starring theymos? Or, in case it's none of these movies, does anybody know a documentary where he appears?Why don't you ask him yourself?It's just one message away and I am sure he will tell you the truth Joke aside, I know Roger Ver mentioned Theymos a lot in his interviews, so it's possible they made some documentary to discredit him, maybe while Roger joined forces with Faketoshi CSW.On the other hand, Bitcointalk forum has been mentioned many times in documentaries, and I think that is more important.
